office: Member of the House of Lords, for Conservative Hereditary Peers
awards: Fellow of the Royal Society of Literature (1999)
Fellow of the Academy of Medical Sciences (2004)
alma_mater: Eton College, University of Oxford (BA, DPhil)
known_for: ''The Red Queen: Sex and the Evolution of Human Nature'' (1994)
''Genome: The Autobiography of a Species in 23 Chapters'' (1999)
thesis_title: Mating system of the pheasant (Phasianus colchicus)
